alert.note: Alert for Southern Twin Falls County; Southwest Highlands; Upper Treasure Valley; Western Magic Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 2:21PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Twin Falls, southeastern Elmore, east central Owyhee and southwestern Gooding Counties through 245 PM MDT... At 220 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles north of Mountain Home Air Force Base to near Deadman Flat to near Horse Butte. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mountain Home, Glenns Ferry, Buhl, Hagerman, Bliss, Castleford, Bennett Mountain, Hammett, Hot Springs Creek Reservoir and Blair Trail Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Southern Twin Falls County; Southwest Highlands; Upper Treasure Valley; Western Magic Valley
